item.description:
7 pm – Professional Development Speaker

Ross Lohr, Executive Director of the Newton-Tanzania Collaborative (NTC) and Co-founder of Project Repat.  
NTC's mission is to improve educational opportunities for Tanzanian children through development initiatives and relationship building between schools and communities in the United States and Tanzania.  Since 2006, NTC has initiated cultural exchange between schools and communities in the United States and Tanzania, facilitated over 100 exchange visits to and from Tanzania, and completed projects that have resulted in children's literacy, girls scholarship, water and sanitation, and technology projects in Tanzania. 
Project Repat, Ross' other passion, is an organization that purchases t-shirt castoffs from secondhand markets in developing countries, and then rebrands and resells the shirts in the United States.  100% of the profits from resale are donated to nonprofit organizations that are active in those same developing countries, essentially double-supporting them.
NTC

www.NewtonTanzania.org

Project Repat
www.ProjectRepat.org 


8 pm – General Meeting

Come join us for our Professional Development Speaker and regularly scheduled meeting. We allot roughly 45 minutes for each speaker (usually 30 minutes for presentation and 15 minutes Q&A) then we begin the meeting at 8pm and discuss all the exciting happenings of the club! Come for one event, or both! All are welcome, so please feel free to bring a friend! We will likely head out for a drink or two after the meeting, so plan to make a night of it! :D
item.how_to_find_us: Walk into 116 Beacon, down the hall & take the stairs on the left going down. Follow the signs for Boston Rotaract to the Trustee's Reading Room (TRR)!

group.name: Boston Rotaract - A Service/Social Club for 18-30 Yr Olds

item.name: Boston Rotaract Speaker and General Meeting
